title: Low-Country Shrimp Boil
directions: In a 6- to 7-quart slow cooker combine the broth, potatoes, sausage, onions, Old Bay seasoning, and cayenne pepper. Place corn on top of the potato mixture. Cover and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or on high for 3 1/2 to 4 hours or or until corn and potatoes are just tender.
If using low, turn to high. Gently stir the shrimp into the potato mixture. Cover and cook for 10 minutes more or until shrimp are opaque.

Using a slotted spoon, transfer shrimp mixture to an extra-large bowl. Pour butter over shrimp mixture; toss gently to coat. Spoon some of the cooking liquid over the mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with cocktail sauce.
ingredients: cups reduced-sodium chicken broth or water
pound tiny red or yellow new potatoes
ounces cooked andouille or kielbasa sausage, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
cup frozen small whole onions, thawed
tablespoon Old Bay seasoning or crab and shrimp boil seasoning
ears fresh sweet corn, husks and silks removed and cut crosswise into quarters
pounds fresh or frozen large shrimp in shells, thawed
